titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Norman Kelvin is Distinguished Professor of English at the City University of New York. His publications include A Troubled Eden: Nature and Society in the Works of George Meredith and E. M. Forster. He is the editor of The Collected Letters of William Morris as well as a collection of essays titled William Morris on Art and Socialism.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Norman Kelvin related to Kelvin's The Collected Letters of William Morris. Materials include: correspondence, including art historian Raymond Watkinson; drafts of manuscripts; galley proofs; research notes; and articles and catalogs. The collection also contains photocopies of transcripts for letters written by William Morris in 1878-1879.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
